page.title: 20THE FARMS
page.content:
There are a number of established farms in the area. The main{crops}are wheat, barley and rape.
At Cross Weir Farm{sheep and pigs}are reared for their meat. At Middle Farm and at Bencroft Farm sheep and{cattle are raised for meat.
Goosey's Lodge, originally a farm, is now a{meat refrigeration}plant operating under the name of Chettles. As a sideline they use rotting offal to breed maggots for anglers.
There is no{dairy farming}in the area although one or two people keep goats} for their own milk supply.
This survey was carried out by members of the 21st Leicester (Stoneygate Baptist) Scout Group.
